page.title: 12The Railway of Endon (2).
page.content: The branch line to Stanley Flint Mill was a private line running alongside the main line for about a half a kilometre then it crossed over the Caldon Canal and through the fields into the mill.To cross the canal a turntable bridge was erected.This was secured lengthways along the centre of the canal to allow boats to pass it on either side,and when needed for use, a plank was placed from the bank side to the centre of the bridge to allow a man to cross and release the safety catches.The bridge was then turned by pulling and when in the right position the safety catches were set in their stops on the bank and towpath.The train carried on across.Then the turntable was reset to its original position,and the operator returned to the bank across the plank.There are still the remains of the bridge there today.
